{{other ships|HMS Melampus}} {|{{Infobox ship begin}} {{Infobox ship image |Ship image=[[File:HMS Melampus 1890.jpg|300px]] |Ship caption=HMS ''Melampus'' }} {{Infobox ship career |Hide header= |Ship country={{nowrap|United Kingdom}} |Ship flag={{shipboxflag|UK|naval}} |Ship name=HMS ''Melampus'' |Ship namesake=[[Melampus]] |Ship ordered= |Ship builder=[[Vickers]], [[Barrow-in-Furness]] |Ship laid down=1889<ref>Conway's All the World's Fighting Ships 1860–1905. p. 76.</ref> |Ship launched= 2 Aug 1890 |Ship acquired= |Ship commissioned= |Ship decommissioned= |Ship reclassified= |Ship in service= |Ship out of service= |Ship renamed= |Ship struck= |Ship reinstated= |Ship honours= |Ship captured= |Ship fate=Sold on 1 Jan 1910<ref name="flixco.info">{{cite web|url=http://navalhistory.flixco.info/H/221200/8330/a0.htm|title=HMS Melampus 1890}}</ref> |Ship status= |Ship notes= }} {{Infobox ship characteristics |Hide header= |Header caption= |Ship beam={{convert|43|ft|8|in|m|abbr=on}}<ref name="battleships-cruisers.co.uk">{{cite web|url=http://www.battleships-cruisers.co.uk/hms_melampus.htm|title=HMS Melampus|publisher=}}</ref> |Ship draught={{convert|17|ft|6|in|m|abbr=on}} |Ship speed={{convert|19.7|kn|mph km/h|lk=in}}<ref name="battleships-cruisers.co.uk"/> |Ship propulsion= |Ship complement=273<ref name="flixco.info"/> to 275<ref name="battleships-cruisers.co.uk"/> |Ship armament=*two 6" guns *six 4.7" guns *eight 6-pounder guns *one 3-pounder all quick-firers |Ship notes= }} |}
'''HMS ''Melampus''''' was an {{sclass-|Apollo|cruiser|0}} [[protected cruiser]] of the [[Royal Navy]] which served from 1890 to 1910.
==History== [[File:H.M.S. Melampus in all her glory (7829727704).jpg|thumb|HMS ''Melampus'' in the harbour of Kingstown, Co. Dublin]] [[File:HMS Melampus 1892 Q 42668.jpg|thumb|HMS ''Melampus'' in 1892.]] In 1890, building by the Naval Construction and Armaments Co, later known as Vickers, commenced. She was originally built for the Greek navy.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.nyc.ie/2010/02/return-of-an-old-friend/|title=Return of an "Old Friend" - NYC|author=NYC|publisher=}}</ref>
In 1891, when [[George V]] was promoted to commander, he assumed command of HMS ''Melampus''. He relinquished his post in January 1892, when his brother [[Albert Victor]] died.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.theodora.com/encyclopedia/g/george_v_of_britain.html|title=George V of Britain - Encyclopedia|publisher=}}</ref>
On 5 Jul 1892, in Portsmouth, HMS ''Melampus'' went out to carry out trials of her machinery and other equipment, following which she swung her compasses at Spithead. She sails the 7th for Plymouth and Falmouth.<ref name="pbenyon.plus.com">http://www.pbenyon.plus.com/18-1900/M/02980.html</ref>
On 26 Jun 1897, she was present at the Naval Review at Spithead in celebration of the Diamond Jubilee.<ref name="pbenyon.plus.com"/>
On 16 Jan 1901, she accidentally grounded [[HMS Sybille (1890)]].<ref name="flixco.info"/>
In 1903 she was withdrawn as [[guard ship]] at [[Dún Laoghaire|Kingstown]] in Ireland.<ref>{{cite journal|first=Cormac F.|last=Lowth|title=Guard-Ships at Kingstown|journal=Dun Laoghaire Journal|volume=23|year=2014|pages=10-19}}</ref>
On 1 Jan 1910, HMS ''Melampus'' was sold to breakers.<ref name="flixco.info"/>
==Captains== * [[George V]], 29 June 1892<ref>The National Archives. ADM 196/42. f. 255.</ref> * Captain Henry H. Dyke, 25 May 1901<ref>"Naval & Military Intelligence" (Official Appointments and Notices). The Times. Wednesday, 29 May 1901. Issue 36467, col B, p. 4.</ref>
